quote: This above all: to thine own self be true, And it must follow, as the night the day, Thou canst not then be false to any man. [ Hamlet, I.iii.84-86 ]
There are more things in Heaven and Earth, Horatio, Than are dreamt of in your philosophy. [ Hamlet, I.v.187-188 ]
Why then, 'tis none to you, for there is nothing either good or bad but thinking makes it so. [ Hamlet, II.ii.268-270]
